metadata.titel_preek: Twelfth Sunday After Pentecost: Trinity and Psalm 130

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Paul's emotional state in 2 Corinthians and the theological depth of Psalm 130. Focus on the nature of the Trinity as self-giving love and the necessity of confession.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong historical-critical and liturgical context provided regarding the BCP and Pauline epistles.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's love and the reality of sin, with a concluding shift toward blessing and petition.
voorbeelden: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
This is no dry scholarly doctrine.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort through the realization of God's relentless love; humility through the recognition of sin.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; the Spirit is mentioned as part of the Trinitarian formula but not explicitly as the agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance.
The psalm itself is a clear demonstration.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; promises are often quoted as biblical facts (assertive) rather than direct pastoral commitments.

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High in the liturgical frame (benediction), but lower in the body of the sermon.

indicatoren: Historical analysis of the Book of Common Prayer changes.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer learns about the Trinity and Sin but remains an observer of the 'event' rather than a participant.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of God's action now
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without necessarily experiencing the 'encounter'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The benediction is the strongest toezegging, but it is treated as a 'quote' or 'invocation' rather than a direct speech act from the preacher to the congregation.
voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used for illustrations ('Imagine you are a parent') and the final blessing.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used more for mental exercises than for declaring grace.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode: talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and 'the love of God'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere where God is the object of study.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God is love) -> Directive (Reflect on your life).
voorbeelden: God is self-giving love... Reflect on your own life.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The movement skips the declarative/commissive 'event' and moves straight to the hearer's introspection.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The transition from the depth of sin to the promise of mercy in the Psalm 130 section.
voorbeelden: With the Lord there is mercy... and he shall redeem Israel.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Moderate; relies on the biblical text to do the performative work rather than the preacher's own illocution.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: There is forgiveness with you; therefore you shall be feared.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Imagine... you would do anything... (Hypothetical imperative without immediate indicative foundation).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a high-quality theological reflection that explains the 'why' and 'how' of grace and sin but remains largely in the realm of 'talking about' (constative).

sterke_punten.effect: Establishes the weight of the words used.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love.
zwakke_punten.probleem: It describes the love rather than bestowing it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon feels like a preparation for an event (the liturgy/benediction) rather than being the event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a commentator on the sacrament of the Word rather than a mandatory of the Word.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the sentences, but rarely the 'I' speaking through the preacher.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a teacher/guide.
tekstueel_bewijs: I may leave you today... invoking... the blessing.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's reflection.
tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that not a single one of us...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Weak; the sermon explains the means of grace (the Psalm, the BCP) rather than being one.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is no dry scholarly doctrine.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'give', 'forgive', and 'promise'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God pours out that love for you, to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is quoted from the Psalm rather than spoken to the people.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'Toezegging' (Promise) as the climax of the sermon body.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ has died, I declare to you: there is no record of your sins.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on Paul's psychology.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Connect Paul's desperation directly to the congregation's current needs.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones Paul is writing to; this grace is for your specific brokenness.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is okay, but the indicative is too 'factual'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically rich and beautifully written, but would benefit from shifting from a 'lecture about grace' to an 'act of grace'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' as a parent; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the benediction.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer that God is love; SAT seeks to make the hearer experience being loved through the speech act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final 5% (the blessing), while the first 95% is largely preparatory constative work.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The only moment the sermon truly 'happens' as an event.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Locutionary' beauty of the BCP and the Psalms to carry the 'Illocutionary' weight.
